summary: The COVID-19 pandemic took a toll on the U.S. economy, as well as the economies of state and local governments. Tax revenues in the 2nd quarter of 2020 dropped by $61 billion compared to the same period in 2019. Revenues rebounded in the 3rd and 4th quarters. title: State and Local Governments: Fiscal Conditions During the COVID-19 Pandemic in Selected States
